subject: My wheel and pedals are interfering with each other
description_text:
Hi, I have the Simpson pro plus pedals. And currently, my SIM magic wheel
is interfering with my brake pedal. Every time I turn the wheel, it
activates my break. And depending on where I have my dead zone set at it
can register anything from 1 to 2 percent or as high as 60% force on my
break. It does not register any pressure on the gas but the white line in
device settings does move a small amount. How do I fix this? I have tried
calibrating multiple times, changing the u s b port and i've also tried
changing the cable. I've unplugged and plugged the pedals back in, but
nothing I have done so far seems to have made any difference

conversations.body_text: Hi Stephen Huntington,    Have you connected the green ground wire from the controller box to any screw on the pedal? Please make sure it’s properly connected to the metal layer—some paint may need to be removed to ensure a reliable ground connection.  Alternatively, you can connect the pedal mount, PC, or base unit to your household ground. Devices like Simagic and Fanatec bases can generate electrical interference, and if your PC and base are not properly grounded, it may affect the stability of other devices, especially during gameplay.
